commit_message:
bgpvpn: agent extension, fix port association 'routes' update

This change fixes the code to handle port association updates:
if an update adds routes and removes routes, we were
only detaching removed routes.

Change-Id: Ib8c7d3162d5322702ad6a149f903b1c705daabd8
Closes-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

There is no definition for "status" and "status_description" params
in the pool.
The protocol_port of listener and the delay of healthmonitor is an
integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa

commit_message:
Restore branch conditional on tempest-full

This change partially reverts I5d34e5b983b720dc1913d00ccc1a16d81a040d49.
Since the branch conditional can be more effectively applied on the
job definition located in the tempest repo, there is no need to change
the original override.

Partial-bug: 1739829
Depends-on: I8e0aa11cd2d92d5d6f5e9147a407374948920e7f
Change-Id: Ibfbc925af6eb274ced53312301b1733136ba4455

subject: Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config dir
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 11:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['toci-quickstart/config/collect-logs.yml'], 'message': 'Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config dir

We're facing an issue in upgrade CI where paunch fails with "sequence
item 33: expected string, list found", it's hard to see what triggered
the issue, being able to look at the step config fed into paunch could
help.

This is how the dir looks on my current deployment:

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# du -h /var/lib/tripleo-config/
176K    /var/lib/tripleo-config/

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# ls -1 /var/lib/tripleo-config/
docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
puppet_step_config.pp

Change-Id: I6dea408e5740176906d7257388062302d31a6369
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config dir

We're facing an issue in upgrade CI where paunch fails with "sequence
item 33: expected string, list found", it's hard to see what triggered
the issue, being able to look at the step config fed into paunch could
help.

This is how the dir looks on my current deployment:

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# du -h /var/lib/tripleo-config/
176K    /var/lib/tripleo-config/

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# ls -1 /var/lib/tripleo-config/
docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_4.json
hashed-docker-container-startup-config-step_5.json
puppet_step_config.pp

Change-Id: I6dea408e5740176906d7257388062302d31a6369

subject: Add tempest-plugins to projects.txt
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-20 18:14:34.000000000', 'files': ['projects.txt'], 'message': 'Add tempest-plugins to projects.txt

All these tempest-plugin repos now use the check-requirements template,
so add them to the list of projects so that they get updated together
with the projects they test.

Note this change also sorts projects.txt alphabetically again.

Change-Id: Ifc631b29cd4d782280b6d38afd90ca6979e424fc

commit_message:
Add tempest-plugins to projects.txt

All these tempest-plugin repos now use the check-requirements template,
so add them to the list of projects so that they get updated together
with the projects they test.

Note this change also sorts projects.txt alphabetically again.

Change-Id: Ifc631b29cd4d782280b6d38afd90ca6979e424fc
Depends-On: Id616198554f6261f4a3557a7c2d97c24c5be0a58

memory to schedule instance' printed full memory instead of
available memory

commit_message:

This adds the 'local_pref' attribute to the BGPVPN resource,
in the DB model definition and migration script, and also
in the API dicts.

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I677d4a215000ae662bb981462c7f000653054d9b

commit_message:
Fix the storage group missing for external ceph

Using external Ceph with Kolla means there is no storage node for
kolla, but cinder-volume must be run on nodes(it can be controller
nodes or compute nodes), and the external-ceph-guide miss storage node,
this patch to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1740028
Change-Id: I6cfb86c5c0d7b30291bd9f263fb030e4703d9602

commit_message:
Deprecates old OpenContrail driver

The first OpenContrail Driver was not developed with production ready in mind,
it was more a proof of concept. We do not recommend to use it in production.
Instead a production ready driver is available in the OpenContrail
monolithic Neutron core plugin tree.
This patch deprecates the driver in the Queens release and we plan to
completly remove it in Rocky release.

Change-Id: I07a7e462e174207499f0641a15467a7122447b7e
Partial-Bug: #1743820

commit_message:
bugs-fixed-since: add argument to list StoryBoard entries

If enabled, this includes StoryBoard stories in the output, with a
"storyboard:" prefix.

Example output:
$ ./bugs-fixed-since.py -sb -r ../octavia --start=1.0.0
storyboard:2001193
storyboard:2001424
1713873
storyboard:2001401
[...]

This is disabled for compatibility with other tools parsing
bugs-fixed-since output

Change-Id: Iddde675254a8622d498cab581d522bffdd7fbaae

commit_message:
db: refresh port association db object after route update

When routes are removed or added to a port association
DB, we need to refresh our DB object or else the dict
produced will be generated from the non-updated set of
routes.

Change-Id: Ib77813247058a4dafed5c36b3dc46717282f200a
Related-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
helm-toolkit prometheus service annotation clean up

This adds checks for the fields in the service annotations for
prometheus, similar to the pod annotations. It changes the
setting of annotations by ingesting a prometheus: key under a
top-level monitoring tree to allow for configuration of other
monitoring solutions aside from prometheus

Change-Id: Id05f235ae07407ea4dcd45bce3a26dd92293b116

commit_message:
only make single request for container listings

The proxy was making multiple backend requests for each
container object or shard range listing when handling a
sharded container listing, but only using one response.
Change that to use a single subrequest.

Also re-work _get_sharded in attempt to make flow easier
to follow and get better separation of the sharding state
special cases.

Also add unit tests for sharded container listing handling
in proxy controller.

Change-Id: I1a99d606ef5c6e980879c116d4ad8d3da39fd247

subject: Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-12 15:02:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

commit_message:
Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

Drive-by fix for container listing limit param not being cast to int
before being used in calculations.

Adds new probe test specifically to test listings with params during
sharding.

Change-Id: Ib38d75e04008509f4934bddf885fe030e56dfad0

commit_message:
[placement] Fix getting placement request ID

In response headers, there is no 'openstack-request-id' header.
So it is not necessary to check the 'openstack-request-id' header.

And 'x-openstack-request-id' is defined in oslo.middleware.
So use the constant value in oslo.middleware.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: Id14fb86ea9786bb22eb6b206cb10f115f9b56ea2
(cherry-picked from commit 560ebe4a56fb45e222d6b008eaabf87b2ccd53e4)

commit_message:
Undeprecate [scenario]/img_dir

The ``[scenario]/img_dir`` option was prematurely deprecated ahead of
providing a replacement option. Even though the eventual intention is to
be able to remove it in favor of requiring a full path to the image to
upload[1], this has not been fully implemented and the option is still
required if the user wants to use anything but the default. This patch
undeprecates the option so that, while the other work is being
completed, the option can be used without creating a frustrating user
experience. When a replacement option is introduced, this option can be
deprecated again.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1393881
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/scenario/manager.py?h=17.2.0#n389

Change-Id: I320237b84b641749aa0db3967e957c9ae94e5ea2
Closes-bug: #1740258

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

Change-Id: I0a8a5ac589b121e3a3ee98979c53340a1467f45c

[{'created': '2018-01-15 12:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_agent_extension_api.py'], 'message': "OVSBridge: add --strict to allow priority in delete_flows

simplify n8g-sfc code.

This change adds a 'strict' boolean parameter to mod_flow and delete_flows
that results in ovs-ofctl to be run with --strict for del-flows and
mod-flows actions.  When strict is set, the use of priority is allowed

commit_message:
OVSBridge: add --strict to allow priority in delete_flows

n8g-sfc currently has its own variant of OVSBridge to allow the use
of priority in a delete_flows call

This change is meant to make this available outside n8g-sfc and
simplify n8g-sfc code.

This change adds a 'strict' boolean parameter to mod_flow and delete_flows
that results in ovs-ofctl to be run with --strict for del-flows and
mod-flows actions.  When strict is set, the use of priority is allowed
and hence not rejected anymore.

Note that for batched actions in a deffered bridge, we disallow mixing
calls with strict and without strict, which can't be translated in one CLI
call.

Needed-By: I3bf939590dd43bff685f133bff86eb7e9068de91
Change-Id: I289d546780f10dc1002ab6bc2e1b38c9ef2d728f
(cherry picked from commit 5981bf416d39f8ec15c937dabaf16d39a101d6ee)

commit_message:
Add zipl support for s390 architecture with SCSI boot

s390x architecture has zipl as a bootloader. It requires special
treatment in order to make the image bootable.
After mounting the image we install a SCSI-type bootmap on the
volume.

addressed conflict with 287784

Change-Id: I88fb1e4cb8abc28663798e5d22d3a9d209a0e05e
Signed-off-by: Holger Smolinski <smolinski@de.ibm.com>

subject: XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 09:13:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will take the responsibility to manage
  OVS located in XenServer dom0; the existing agent server -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will take the responsibilty on other
  OVS functions - e.g. neutron-dhcp-agent, neutron-l3-agent, etc.
  So when virt driver is XenAPI, this new service will be eanbled
  on the hosts which belong to `compute`; the existing service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will be eanbled on the hosts which
  require OVS agent for non-compute purposes.

* Customize relative configure options for XenAPI.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-12-08 09:26:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* Customize relative configure options for XenAPI.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses

dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi

  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieve XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.

  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

commit_message:
XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieves XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

* At the moment, l2_population doesn't for for XenAPI. So disable it.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 04:02:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to boostrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need boostrap it firstly. The package of os-xenapi
has a tool developed to finish all of the needed boostrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
boostrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Depends-On: Ie2d7d40f2755580aac4a10f3d302190a8bd4fe6f
Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d

commit_message:
XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to bootstrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need bootstrap it firstly. The package of
python-os-xenapi contains a tool and some utils which were developed
to finish all of the needed bootstrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
bootstrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Depends-On: Ie2d7d40f2755580aac4a10f3d302190a8bd4fe6f
Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d

commit_message:
Added the limit on selection of delayed calls

It would be good when you have many Mistral-Engine instances.
It distributes selection of delayed calls between all of them.
Also replaced the sleep function by the await function in the tests.

Change-Id: I4f0e0a79ff8169ee4e9b359015db22898f634614
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Use stevedore for binding drivers

In order to avoid direct usage of importutils, this
change brings the usage of stevedore. Import paths
are going to be specified in setup.cfg.

Change-Id: I6628279a8c090ae5827ad6e0257ce7cf9526be0d
Closes-Bug: #1645589

commit_message:
Add 'update' command to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the 'update' command.

The trove command update is now:
    openstack database instance update

Change-Id: I426c892540f82bc19b7b28d7845a2f6699c3f526
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
elif replace if

3 'if' at same levels and each 'if' has 'return',
in this case, elif is better than if.
more readable, more effective.

Change-Id: Ib0528ab69679f320f1580971945ce36eaaedf011
Signed-off-by: peiy <peiy@rc.inesa.com>

commit_message:
Wait for volume creation

If users create a container with new cinder volumes and the volumes
are 'creating'. Zun should wait for the volume creation before
proceeding the container creation process.

Change-Id: I423a69a97271a2acdd73a85cccddb65b052d169e
Closes-Bug: #1740942

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for magnum

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Magnum. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'magnum_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Magnum project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Id479bf4dc77ee4a2367c9c7d8f0f00de761b8c85

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 23:26:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Track associated sharing RPs in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient keeps track of any sharing
providers associated by aggregate with the compute node RP in the same
way as traits and aggregates.  Specifically:

- We use ProviderTree methods to save the information for each provider.
- We refresh sharing RP information along with aggregate and trait
  information whenever we "ensure" a provider exists.

Note that we also retrieve and track the aggregates and traits
associated with each sharing provider.

The refreshing (including cache expiry) of sharing RPs is done in the
same method with that of aggregate and trait associations.  The theory
being that all of these associations should change out of band with
roughly the same frequency (i.e. very rarely).

Change-Id: I840ebc7940e65af30e66d902bf360668ccb5a30e

commit_message:
Track associated sharing RPs in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient keeps track of any sharing
providers associated by aggregate with the compute node RP in the same
way as traits and aggregates.  Specifically:

- We use ProviderTree methods to save the information for each provider.
- We refresh sharing RP information along with aggregate and trait
  information whenever we "ensure" a provider exists.

Note that we also retrieve and track the aggregates and traits
associated with each sharing provider.

The refreshing (including cache expiry) of sharing RPs is done in the
same method with that of aggregate and trait associations.  The theory
being that all of these associations should change out of band with
roughly the same frequency (i.e. very rarely).

Change-Id: I840ebc7940e65af30e66d902bf360668ccb5a30e
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

subject: Access Tempest config.CONF directly
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 17:16:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_heat_api.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/common/test.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Access Tempest config.CONF directly

This ensures that all Tempest plugin configs are loaded. Accessing it
via heat_tempest_plugin.config.CONF assumed that something else was
loading the plugin configs before we tried to access it. This is
probably only the case when running Tempest itself, but we want to be
able to discover and run tests from the heat_integrationtests without
going through Tempest.

Change-Id: I5e9325766ce166e62c731330c462c030cb1e11fc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Access Tempest config.CONF directly

This ensures that all Tempest plugin configs are loaded. Accessing it
via heat_tempest_plugin.config.CONF assumed that something else was
loading the plugin configs before we tried to access it. This is
probably only the case when running Tempest itself, but we want to be
able to discover and run tests from the heat_integrationtests without
going through Tempest.

Change-Id: I5e9325766ce166e62c731330c462c030cb1e11fc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26576, 'name': 'yanpeifei', 'email': 'yanpeifei@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'yanpeifei', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 22:40:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py'], 'message': 'Handle missing flavor.id in server response

Change Ie2d57029ad01cbe9e2b015857d6b95f77a97be19 introduced checks
for a servers flavor ID. This data is no longer returned after
Nova API microversion 2.46, causing problems for any tests/clients
requesting a higher version number.

Since these tests are not concerned with validating flavors, just
check if it is returned in the base class and skip the check if
it is not available.

Change-Id: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18
Closes-bug: #1744401
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle missing flavor.id in server response

Change Ie2d57029ad01cbe9e2b015857d6b95f77a97be19 introduced checks
for a servers flavor ID. This data is no longer returned after
Nova API microversion 2.46, causing problems for any tests/clients
requesting a higher version number.

Since these tests are not concerned with validating flavors, just
check if it is returned in the base class and skip the check if
it is not available.

Change-Id: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18
Closes-bug: #1744401

subject: Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20190, 'name': 'zhufl', 'email': 'zhu.fanglei@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zhufl'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26576, 'name': 'yanpeifei', 'email': 'yanpeifei@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'yanpeifei', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 10:15:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in
service_available, however that may include services from plugins.
We don't have a strong contract on the meaning of service_available
so this is not correct as it will look in the catalog for things
that may not even be OpenStack services.

Besides the test checks for service_available names in the catalog
so it does not honor the catalog_type setting that we have in
Tempest, so this test will not work if the catalog type is different
from the default value.

Fixing this by restring by services in Tempest (including keystone)
and checking for the catalog_type.

Change-Id: I32f4f056ea49fe04bfc309abe2cc9b9234b92847
Closes-bug: #1743996
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-18 15:59:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in
service_available, however that may include services from plugins.
We don't have a strong contract on the meaning of service_available
so this is not correct as it will look in the catalog for things
that may not even be OpenStack services.

Fixing this by restring by services in Tempest (including keystone).

Change-Id: I32f4f056ea49fe04bfc309abe2cc9b9234b92847
Closes-bug: #1743996

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in

commit_message:
Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in
service_available, however that may include services from plugins.
We don't have a strong contract on the meaning of service_available
so this is not correct as it will look in the catalog for things
that may not even be OpenStack services.

Fixing this by restricting by services in Tempest (including keystone).

Change-Id: I32f4f056ea49fe04bfc309abe2cc9b9234b92847
Closes-bug: #1743996

additional conf argument.

Change-Id: Ieb7962a50fdb5d12ea6238c96ed116e8b2c83c48
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-12-12 21:26:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove oslo config global conf dependency

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make
the following changes in monasca-ceilometer
1.) Monasca Publisher now extends
ConfigPublisherBase, with conf as argument
2.) monasca_client now takes conf as an
argument during intialization.
3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)
4.) Introduced three new properties
service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386025

commit_message:
Remove oslo config global conf dependency

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make
the following changes in monasca-ceilometer
1.) Monasca Publisher now extends
ConfigPublisherBase, with conf as argument
2.) monasca_client now takes conf as an
argument during intialization.
3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)
4.) Introduced three new properties
service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.
5.) Added api/health.py, service.py
and opts.py from ceilometer code base
which were modified to read
monasca ceilometer options via
monasca_ceilometer_opts.py
6.) Added ostestr to test requirements
and updated tox.ini to run tests in
serial (to avoid problems with
singleton mapping classes, stepping
on each other test values  when
run in parallel)

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624

commit_message:
Restrict VNF deletion, if part of Active NS

VNF should not be allowed to delete separately,
if part of an active NS.

Change-Id: I3421a311c7a8dcc6c9c4eec2265c6384370c0972
Closes-Bug: #1691363

subject: Security group deletion
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-05 04:14:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Security group deletion

1. What is the problem?

A security group(sg) may map to several local sg in local neutron.
During the deletion of sg local neutron may recreate the sg if it
recieve a get-request of sg.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

commit_message:
Security group deletion

1. What is the problem?

A security group(sg) may map to several local sg in local neutron.
During the deletion of sg local neutron may recreate the sg if it
recieve a get-request of sg.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: Ia537c8a32f527e64d733b2a0bd7c90b400cd747f

The strings in oslo_utils.strutils.TRUE_STRINGS and

by os_utils.bool_from_string.

use service clients variable defined in base class.

commit_message:
Add a active-standby mode memcached in haproxy

Memcached do not support cluster. Then make it work in active-standby
mode. This will be helpful to implement high available when using memcached
as tooz backend.

Change-Id: I13722111d8b8d5b066e9a85d4c8d1679704c8caa

subject: Document RBAC Policy allowed values
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 18:23:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make RBAC Policy allowed values visible

For entirely spurious reasons, RBAC Policies were validated using a custom
validate() method that is invisible to the user instead of using
constraints to validate values in a way consistent with all other resource
types, and that would appear in the API documentation. This rectifies that
error and improves the documentation and error reporting.

Change-Id: I0cde2fe5dd5c57c6f5a367d0405bcffad01678fa
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-11-06 20:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_neutron_rbac_policy.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/rbac_policy.py'], 'message': 'Document RBAC Policy allowed values

For entirely spurious reasons, RBAC Policies were validated using a custom
validate() method that is invisible to the user instead of using
constraints to validate values in a way consistent with all other resource
types, and that would appear in the API documentation. This rectifies that
error and improves the documentation and error reporting.

Change-Id: I0cde2fe5dd5c57c6f5a367d0405bcffad01678fa
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Document RBAC Policy allowed values

For entirely spurious reasons, RBAC Policies were validated using a custom
validate() method that is invisible to the user instead of using
constraints to validate values in a way consistent with all other resource
types, and that would appear in the API documentation. This rectifies that
error and improves the documentation and error reporting.

Change-Id: I0cde2fe5dd5c57c6f5a367d0405bcffad01678fa

commit_message:
ipv4 address for overcloud nodes in ssh.config.ansible

The ansible_fqdn variable appears to be getting
overwritten during fact gathering.  Create a unique
variable to define the default address for overcloud
nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1742528
Change-Id: I85a2e76c4582e3a95f407e2d1edbf6051bf3525b

commit_message:
Able to change admin state for all resources

Also make the workflow more independent and predictable. Previously it
is using the extensible workflow methods and does not make a copy of
a step for each workflow, which would mess up with each other.

Change-Id: I2e808282ed3c180105978f359fff7558d9e78ca7
Story: 1713844
Task: 5361

commit_message:
Convert bashate-python36-fedora-26 to Zuul v3

Convert the job to native Zuul v3. The repo does not use
upper-constraints, so there's no  need to use openstack/requirements.

Rename the job to follow our naming pattern for tox jobs.

Also, remove project name from stanza, it's not needed for in-tree
configuration anymore.

Change-Id: If79bc60b7e60d172c64dee1cd7900853aa7a1f37

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: Icb2b468eed02340ac797191e98aeed1009b03439

commit_message:
Fix senlin tempest plugin to work properly

* moved testfiles into tests subdirectory
* fix basepath for plugin
* fix entrypoint
* provide steps in README to install and use senlin-tempest-plugin
* add config option when creating clusters to test node naming
* removed test drivers
* fix various test cases
* Replace deprecated aliases 'os'/'os_adm' with 'os_primary'/'os_admin'

Change-Id: I7551783a4e9b2194559c3a400594227b2d9c26b9

commit_message:
Fix the bug that could not create a profile with Chinese availability_zone

There has an error message with " 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in
 position 0-1: ordinal not in range(128)" when I create a profile with
Chinese availability_zone.
Then I found the str(value) send an error if the value is u'\u53ef\u7528\u52ff\u5220'
in schema.py when validate the profile. I add a if to judge the value is
unicode or not.

Closes-Bug: #1739877
Change-Id: I2a6568729a6280cc29c8f58f67a290b289714aac

commit_message:
Use DocumentedRuleDefault instead of RuleDefault

The DocumentedRuleDefault class has advantages over the RuleDefault
class because it allows project developers the opportunity to
describe how policies map to actual APIs. This makes things a lot
easier for operators trying to understand policies for a given
project, and doesn't require them to dig in the code to figure out
what they protect.

Polices are also splitted into small files for easier maintainance.

This is part of an effort to move policy and documentation of policy
into code, treating it like configuration.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifcdbccae7350ec69ad7d92197b9bfca8aeb8352b

commit_message:
Remove local subclass of Object and ObjectField

These two classes were temporary hacks due to bugs in upstream
oslo.versionedobjects. With current global requirements setting version
of oslo.versionedobjects to 1.28, this is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Icec8d9689cd5634c9f29bfdd8899126853cd6550

This patch fixes two unit test errors. One is "ipv6_address_mode not
found", the other is "has no attribute type_manager". The first error
is addressed by the previous patch[1] but cannot be merged due to the
second error, so this patch address these two errors at the same time.

commit_message:
[Urgent] fix unit test errors

This patch fixes two unit test errors. One is "ipv6_address_mode not
found", the other is "has no attribute type_manager". The first error
is addressed by the previous patch[1] but cannot be merged due to the
second error, so this patch address these two errors at the same time.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532417/

Change-Id: Ibda5b5870fa8466b3f5a886ee0c16a2ec8c74abc

commit_message:
Rename zuul v3 job

Rename job to follow naming conventions for a shared global namespace:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Keep old name to allow renaming, a followup will remove it.

Needed-By: I2dd2075e41680d7b85d574575a19531599dabf5e
Change-Id: Id2aed659c1fcb7333b7efa4dc0a019d21bdcd51a

subject: Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-20 06:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/objects/fields.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py'], 'message': 'Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver

When I create a receiver for a cluster,there has
failed with the error message "HttpException:
Internal Server Error"

Then I found there has not the function get_schema()
in ClusterActionName class and ReceiverType class,
so that raise NotImplementedError() from the class
FieldType of oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Then I add the get_schema() in ClusterActionName and
ReceiverType and fix this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1744426
Change-Id: Ie29e1dffdedb37b117ec698fba434084f5d5f831
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver

When I create a receiver for a cluster,there has
failed with the error message "HttpException:
Internal Server Error"

Then I found there has not the function get_schema()
in ClusterActionName class and ReceiverType class,
so that raise NotImplementedError() from the class
FieldType of oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Then I add the get_schema() in ClusterActionName and
ReceiverType and fix this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1744426
Change-Id: Ie29e1dffdedb37b117ec698fba434084f5d5f831

commit_message:
Use version definition from openstack.version

Having openstack/__init__.py referencing pbr is causing some problems
sometimes when invoking sdk apis. This patch propose using the version
definition from version module under openstack/.

This is a follow up of 2f05a3d0667efa07004c71e13217f1ed6d95b198.

Change-Id: I3117becd0e91514447a426f2fec4d133dd11f404

commit_message:
Remove hack for ubuntu cloud archive

There is a hack here to set up ubuntu cloud archive, pinning it to
mirror.dfw.rax.openstack.org. The mirror-info role seems to be doing
this correctly now though, so let's remove the hack and let things work
normally.

Change-Id: I283cb3452245b64e9492806f06404b484f21c358

commit_message:

and it is dependency of both testrepository
and os-testr
(probably was used by some tox wrapper script before)

commit_message:
Add restart to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the restart command

The trove command restart is now:
    openstack database instance restart

Change-Id: I24eeb001d27eae39be5c33650e9bc04287053c8c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add tempest-stress project repo

tempest-stress is to perform stress testing of cloud
using tempest. This framework used to be in tempest
earlier but due to tempest scope it had been moved
out of tempest tree.

During queens PTG (even earlier) we discussed to make
it in separate repo.

Needed-By: Ib6fb2eac8568f6e86aae24782bfa6d9cca4fe54c

Change-Id: I063303642f5c99e4ca95d0e02c2360a003688ad6

commit_message:
Make meta.find_best_address() more generic

This function now can choose address family with socket.getaddrinfo()
method and there is no need to pass address family as argument to it.

Change-Id: I72b1c1263876f2d047e5e540b72f2550ec73b65c
Story: 2001475
Task: 6213

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-20 20:59:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/meta.py'], 'message': 'Make floating IP to be prefered over fixed when looking for IP

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make floating IP to be prefered over fixed when looking for IP

We can assume that floating IP is public IP address in clouds so
floating IPs should be checked first if they can be used to
connect to instance.

Change-Id: I1024d78e68a788bf5a92cb63d008c02180908dfa
Story: 2001475
Task: 6212

subject: Install OpenStack client as requirement
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 11:02:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'init-runonce: check OpenStack client version

Debian ships 3.2.1 which is far too old but script is happy as it is
installed. Then errors appear.

Change-Id: I70a9c5ed3a6ef671affb01b1a87a799e23d6b0e2
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-21 10:23:07.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Install OpenStack client as requirement

Last part of deploying is running 'tools/init-runonce' script which uses
'openstack' client script.

There is a check is 'openstack' client installed but no
version/functionality check. And this is a problem if there is system
wide python-openstackclient installed in old version (like 3.2.1 in
Debian 'stretch'). Script will finish despite generating bunch of errors
and final deployment will lack networking.

Change-Id: I70a9c5ed3a6ef671affb01b1a87a799e23d6b0e2
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Install OpenStack client as requirement

Last part of deploying is running 'tools/init-runonce' script which uses
'openstack' client script.

There is a check is 'openstack' client installed but no
version/functionality check. And this is a problem if there is system
wide python-openstackclient installed in old version (like 3.2.1 in
Debian 'stretch'). Script will finish despite generating bunch of errors
and final deployment will lack networking.

Change-Id: I70a9c5ed3a6ef671affb01b1a87a799e23d6b0e2

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Constraints is the mechanism that our CI and deployers use to reduce
introduce new libraries into OpenStack in a controlled fashion, ensure
co-installability across the entire OpenStack code base and removed
known bad library releases from consideration.

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstacksdk.

This work is part of a larger effort from the requirements management
team to enable flexibility in our requirements management while still
documenting and enforcing co-installability.

Change-Id: I72da07d0afd63c3c00805475f8d440c68db704dd

commit_message:
Fix download_object for Python 3

This fixes the following error message when downloading an object to
a file: "TypeError: must be str, not bytes".

commit_message:
Invert the attribute mapping

requests returns headers in a CaseInsensitiveDict because Headers are
case insensitive. Unfortunately, that only applies to keys, and our
current attribute mapping that we use to consume values from payloads is
{client_name: server_name}, which means we have to go through
shenanigans to get the comparison right.

Invert the mapping returned by _get_mapping and update the logic to
deal with the inversion.

While we're at it, remove _filter_component, as _consume_attrs already
does the same thing and handles the case sensitivity properly.

Change-Id: Ice38cc31635a364839472248f3814b0c8f65bfe1

commit_message:
log: augment json records

The ContextFormatter gathers more information about the request than
the JSONFormatter, which is rather opposite to what one might expect.
This patch pulls that logic out into a separate method allowing it to
be reused.

Change-Id: I69063d687648343552e66e47e1e9a55b37eb24c2
Closes-Bug: #1564931

commit_message:
Remove deprecated config options 'resources_prefix'

Config option 'resources_prefix' was deprecated. It is
used by only manila plugin which fix has been commited.

This commit removes this config option and hardcode the
resource prefix as 'tempest'

Change-Id: Idce7af97fe6647e3095b2b626fbacb3446694fbc
Depends-On: I9c140b3a9efabeced7fc26cb1f169ebe6789d88b

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I2c79aceb98934cda962dcaf13db896d7f55086b8

commit_message:
nimble: handle unicode strings in volume create

currently nimble cinder driver doesn't handle unicode strings
for display_name and display_description

Change-Id: Ic94cbc50d5761c7fc67d2973bed70c70cf6bf769
Closes-Bug: 1732812
(cherry picked from commit 23ac0ab4edd38b91b0c21d5c9e81cd1a7bdddc55)

subject: Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 15:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_manila_handlers.py', 'src/reactive/manila_handlers.py'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I6e025438bacd17dfb2a6f61fb8ca274187009c57
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I6e025438bacd17dfb2a6f61fb8ca274187009c57

commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

Note: cherry-picked from master at b902df7e0e

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I192b74ce0e50a3aa796071a88ebdd9fda4c0fff7

forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

subject: Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 14:35:39.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/manila_generic.py', '.gitignore'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with

Change-Id: I282bf7fc864f9066596c20ba6175283e934e7c12
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I282bf7fc864f9066596c20ba6175283e934e7c12

commit_message:
Fix api-ref for v3 volume group types

This patch is mainly to fix api-ref for v3 volume group types,
including:

1. add description and example for the API: show defaut group type
2. fix parameters: 'is_public' and 'description'
3. remove unused sample file: group-type-show-request.json

Change-Id: I29f160d8ed24473debb345b4ea91ee0545d711b1

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ia3c3db073136fd491749cb02895012e97650592f

commit_message:
Add events and resources for L3 flavors.

To address the callbacks in L3 flavor drivers for OpenDaylight
new event and resources are added to handle router request.
They are introduced initially in neutron [1]. but neutron-lib
is the right place to have them.

[1].https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523257/

Change-Id: I1e72ee843851004d26410a90da4030ab3b024741

commit_message:
Fix server post deploy step with config-download

Due to a misplaced endfor in the j2 template, the deployments.yaml
playbook was only included for the first role. The bogus task playbook
was rendered as:

  - hosts: overcloud
    name: Server Post Deployments
    gather_facts: no
    any_errors_fatal: yes
    tasks:
      - include: Controller/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Controller'
        with_items: "{{ Controller_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps
      - include: Compute/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Compute'
        with_items: "{{ Compute_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps

Change-Id: I625fcaa7c4dcb4f99f30b9d6def293154f4eb7ec
